column4: i cant get the ubuntu to recognise myharddrive to partition any help?
try sudo fdisk -l
nothing shows up yet i can boot windows from this driveperfectly
what is the output of sudo fdisk -l
ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ sudo fdisk -l
, nothing?
yh nothing im booted of the ubuntu live cd atm
, try sudo gparted
nothing shows upin gparted
,try lspci and see if scsi controller is listed
well sata is sometimes called scsi
ok how do i load ubuntu install so it can read my hdd
, do you want to install or just mount from live-cd?
id like to installso i have full speed of linux on my spanky new pc
, just try the "install" buttun on the desktop and see if the partitioner sees your hd
it doens't ive allready tried
so i dont see your problem actually
oh sorry i misunderstood
icant installubuntu because the ubuntu installer wont read my hdd,whichleads me to believe automounting or something is disabled
, ibelieve the kernel should recognize the hd, i dont know why it doesnt
,i would search ubuntuforums.org for the name of the controller and the name of the hd, maybe there really is a bug ?
i should have done that initallyi guess i was taking the easy irc option thanks anyway for trying to help illprobs just install ubuntu on a 5gig seagate
